question: Impure clothes
answer:
QUESTION
I am employed by a large company and obviously working with non-muslims as well. Today, I witnessed a fellow employee consuming bacon & that very same employee, a little while later spoke to me and held me on the shoulder. Upon asking the individual whether he had washed his hands after eating, "No" washis reply. Tell me if it is acceptable to read my Zohr salaah or any salaah fo that matter knowing what that individual had done? Is my clothing napaak? Shukraan
ANSWER


Share:
If the fellow employee did not wash or wipe his hands and there was a
possibility of the remains of bacon being on his hands, then in all
probability, your clothes will be soiled by the fellow employee touching
you. Therefore, the clothing becomes Napaak (impure). It is similar to a dog
licking a person.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
FATWA DEPT.
